entry.et: Middle English, from Old English clāth cloth, garment; akin to Middle High German kleit garment

def.dt: :a pliable material made usually by weaving, felting, or knitting natural or synthetic fibers and filaments
:a piece of cloth adapted for a particular purpose
:a distinctive dress of a profession or calling
:a unit of 37 inches equal to the Scottish ell and used also as a length for arrows
:a protective sheet (as of cloth or plastic) used especially by painters to cover floors and furniture
:a lustrous plain textile of usually loosely woven fibers
:a waterproof sheet placed on the ground for protection (as of a sleeping bag) against soil moisture
:colorfully patterned cloth traditionally woven by hand in Ghana called also kente
:a coarse heavy fabric in basket weave made originally of worsted and used for monk's habits but now chiefly of cotton or linen and used for draperies

entry.et: Spanish piña pineapple, pinecone, from Latin pinea pinecone pineal

def.dt: :a lustrous transparent cloth of Philippine origin that is woven of silky pineapple fibers
:a cloth used between an iron and a garment
